messages.content: "I'd govern like a true Tory if it wasn't for the Lib Dems", David Cameron told the Daily Mail. Time and again, I and my Lib Dem colleagues put a stop to extreme and regressive policies coming out of Conservative HQ. Sometimes in public, but mostly in private, we said no.

We've defended against profit making in schools. We blocked plans to sell off corporations fire employees without a reason. We've quashed attempts to let the security services read all your private emails.
We denied them the chance to cut inheritance tax for the rich or end housing benefit for the under 25s. We stopped them abandoning renewables and banning schools from teaching about climate change.
I don’t agree that the poorest in society should be demonised, as both Labour and the Conservatives think the opposite.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Defended against profit making in schools.
Blocked plans that would have allowed security services to read all private emails.
Denied cuts to inheritance tax for the rich and ending of housing benefit for under 25s.
Stopped abandoning renewables and the ban of teaching climate change in schools.
Opposes the demonization of the poorest in society.

mentions.tacticalSituation: The Bristol Post has said Bristol West is a "two horse race between Lib Dems and Labour" and will probably be "A Lib Dem hold – by a whisker", so your vote really does matter this time.

issues.education: Defended against profit making in schools.
issues.environment: Stopped abandoning renewables and the ban of teaching climate change in schools.

housing.content: Denied cuts to inheritance tax for the rich and ending of housing benefit for under 25s.

endorsements.endorsement: Martin Lewis of MoneySavingExpert.com calls it a "No brainer," you'll pay less than before.

quotes.text: "I'd govern like a true Tory if it wasn't for the Lib Dems", David Cameron told the Daily Mail.
"I don’t agree that the poorest in society should be demonised, as both Labour and the Conservatives think the opposite," says Stephen Williams.

images.caption: Photo of Stephen Williams with a caption 'Stronger Economy, Fairer Society. Opportunity for Everyone.'

leaflet.additionalNotes: P.S. Whatever happens in this election, we need Lib Dems in government again, to keep Britain on the right track to a stronger economy and a fairer society with opportunity for all.
